pgTitle: List of museums in South Dakota

rows.text: website, park with historic Shay-Adams Home with period furnishings, barn, country school and church
Armed Forces Military Display and Gifts
information, private museum displaying foreign and domestic militaria from WWI, WWII, Korea, Vietnam and current US conflicts
information, operated by the Clay County Historical Society
Visitor center exhibits include the geology, paleontology and natural history of the park
website, complex includes museum with period displays, Clark Railroad Depot, a settler's shanty, a pioneer church and school; also known as Clark County Museum
website, includes mine tour and museum
Black Hills Museum of Natural History
website, fossils, dinosaurs, gems, minerals, meteorites
information, includes museum and 1914 one room schoolhouse
Campbell Original Straw Bale Built Museum
Casey Tibbs South Dakota Rodeo Center
website, opening 2009, South Dakota rodeo heritage and memorabilia
information, located in the Lyric Theatre, includes dolls, wildlife of South Dakota, toy tractors and tractors, arts of local areas, cars and a military room
Stave church replica of the Borgund stave church in Norway and 19th century Norwegian log cabin
website, includes antique vehicles, toy cars, model trains
History and heritage of Codington County and the Coteau des Prairie region of northeastern South Dakota
Includes Peter Norbeck Center with natural history and cultural heritage displays, and Badger Hole, the historic house of poet Badger Clark
website, natural, cultural and local history
website, includes museum, country school, carriage barn, and blacksmith shop
website, includes museum, school, depot and caboose
D.C. Booth Historic National Fish Hatchery
website, former hatchery, includes Von Bayer Museum of Fish Culture with exhibits about the history and science of fish culture and fisheries
website, includes the Country School and Railroad House, operated by the Douglas County Historical Society
information, displays over 300 mounted bird species and an assortment of animals from around the world
State park with preserved 1864 fort buildings
website, buildings include a town hall, saloon, general store, church, bank, an outhouse, sheriff's office, jails
information, operated by the Charles Mix County Historical Restoration Society
website, includes local bronze sculptures, ranching, Native American and homestead artifacts, fossils and Creation Science displays
Great Plains Zoo & Delbridge Museum of Natural History
information, antique safes, farm toys and toy racecars
website, displays natural history, history and local history, including pioneer tools, pioneer household items, antiques, toys, vehicles and native wildlife displays
Heritage Center of Red Cloud Indian School
website, Lakota culture and Native art
website, Western art, historic artifacts & memorabilia
website, includes over 40 antique-filled buildings, agricultural displays, steam tractors, a sawmill and a train
website, vinegars from all over the world
information, complex includes one room school, medical office, Western equipment, blacksmith shop, local history artifacts, operated by the Dunham Historical Society
information, features pioneer and Native American artifacts
information, includes museum, one room school and barn with artifacts
Lewis and Clark Center Visitor Center
website, exhibits include natural & cultural history, geology, exploration, Native Americans, steamboats
information, several barns and buildings with agriculture tools and equipment
Active paleontological dig site and museum with fossils of mammoths, ancient flora and fauna
website, pioneer and railroad history and artifacts
Includes visitor center, launch control center and a missile silo/launch facility
South Dakota School of Mines and Technology
Museum of Wildlife, Science and Industry of NE South Dakota
website, features many buildings with exhibits of military, agricultural and pioneer life, antique tractors, cars, and mounted wildlife, restored historic buildings
website, art and sculptures carved in wood
American, European, and non-Western instruments from all cultures and historical periods
website, wax figures of U.S. presidents in historic moments
website, located in the Celebrity Hotel, cars and motorcycles
information, information, includes sculptures and structures built from petrified wood and fossils and the Lemmon Pioneer Museum

website, automobiles, trucks, motorcycles, National Rockhound Hall of Fame & Lapidary, tractors, antiques and collectibles, authentic prairie town that includes a railroad depot, bank, general store, gas station, church, school, camera shop, butcher shop and more
Pioneer Historical Museum of South Dakota
website, antiques, decorative arts, tools, photos
South Dakota Air and Space Museum
US Air Force and South Dakota aviation history
South Dakota Amateur Baseball Hall of Fame
website, museum of the South Dakota Historical Society
Tours include the capitol and First Lady Gown Collection
website, railroad memorabilia, model trains from across South Dakota and Mid-America
website, historic tractors and other farm machinery
Sturgis Motorcycle Museum & Hall of Fame
Features vintage and rare V-twin and metric motorcycles
website, includes fossils, Native American artifacts, period displays
website, operate by the Edgemont Area Historical Society
website, early pioneer, rodeo, and old west history of the Tri-State region of Western South Dakota, Eastern Wyoming and Southeast Montana
University of South Dakota Art Galleries
information, includes Czech Museum, chapel, jail, store, log school and log house
website, modern gold mill and antique mining museum
Washington Pavilion of Arts and Science
Includes the Kirby Science Discover Center and Visual Arts Center with galleries
website, natural history displays, Native American and pioneer artifacts
Visitor center includes three rooms with exhibits about the geology of the caves, the park's natural and cultural history
